heisig_chinese_memo: A slave to crotch maybe, but you are not a slave to your kidneys because your body has two!
heisig_constituent: kidney, loincloth, retainer, slave, crotch, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
koohiiStory1: When the sex slave misbehaves, threaten to sell his body parts starting with his kidney.
koohiiStory2: If you have a weak KIDNEY, you´ll become a SLAVE to your CROTCH´s need to pee. Oh well, it´s just a weakness of the FLESH.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hard (臤) body part (⺼) is the kidney
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You can lose one of your kidneys, but if this part of the body is able to tell you "Foiled again!", then you are probably dead.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " flesh " to the sound of " blind ". The original meaning is kidney. "Shuowen": "Kidney, water is stored. From the flesh, the sound." In ancient times, the five elements and the five internal organs were matched. The kidneys dominate water, so "Shuowen" is called "water storage." Such as "The Yellow Emperor's Internal Classic. "The Golden Chamber True Statement": "The liver, heart, spleen, lung and kidney are all yin." "Shen Nong's Materia Medica." Zhongjing: "Corn: tastes salty and slightly cold. It nourishes kidney qi, removes heat from the stomach and spleen, and replenishes qi."

In Chinese medicine, the testicle is called the external kidney, and also called the kidney in the province. For example, lines 217-218 of Mawangdui's "Fifty-two Disease Prescriptions": "Inner (na) kidney, [yue most] in the hukong (hole)." "Puji Fang. "Illnesses No. 1": "Use a yellow dog to remove the fascia and make an ointment, and then boil the wine into an ointment. The pill is as big as Wutongzi. Take 20 pills per serving and warm the wine."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " flesh " and " blind ". The original meaning is kidney.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「臤」聲。本義是腎臟。《說文》：「腎，水藏也。从肉，臤聲。」古代以五行和五臟相配，其中腎臟主水，故《說文》稱為「水藏」。如《黃帝內經．金匱真言論》：「肝心脾肺腎五藏，皆為陰。」《神農本草經．中經》：「粟米：味鹹微寒。主養腎氣，去胃脾中熱，益氣。」

　　中醫稱睪丸為外腎，又省稱腎。如馬王堆帛書《五十二病方》第217-218行：「即內（納）腎、[月最]於壺空（孔）中。」《普濟方．諸疾一》：「用黃狗外腎，去筋膜細研，依法酒熬成膏，和劑丸如梧桐子大。每服二十丸，溫酒下。」

從「 肉 」，「 臤 」聲。本義是腎臟。《說文》：「腎，水藏也。从肉，臤聲。」古代以五行和五臟相配，其中腎臟主水，故《說文》稱為「水藏」。如《黃帝內經．金匱真言論》：「肝心脾肺腎五藏，皆為陰。」《神農本草經．中經》：「粟米：味鹹微寒。主養腎氣，去胃脾中熱，益氣。」 中醫稱睪丸為外腎，又省稱腎。如馬王堆帛書《五十二病方》第217-218行：「即內（納）腎、[月最]於壺空（孔）中。」《普濟方．諸疾一》：「用黃狗外腎，去筋膜細研，依法酒熬成膏，和劑丸如梧桐子大。每服二十丸，溫酒下。」
From the " flesh" to the sound of " blind". The original meaning is kidney. "Shuowen": "Kidney, water is stored. From the flesh, the sound." In ancient times, the five elements and the five internal organs were matched. The kidneys dominate water, so "Shuowen" is called "water storage." Such as "The Yellow Emperor's Internal Classic. "The Golden Chamber True Statement": "The liver, heart, spleen, lung and kidney are all yin." "Shen Nong's Materia Medica." Zhongjing: "Corn: tastes salty and slightly cold. It nourishes kidney qi, removes heat from the stomach and spleen, and replenishes qi." In Chinese medicine, the testicle is called the external kidney, and also called the kidney in the province. For example, lines 217-218 of Mawangdui's "Fifty-two Disease Prescriptions": "Inner (na) kidney, [yue most] in the hukong (hole)." "Puji Fang. "Illnesses No. 1": "Use a yellow dog to remove the fascia and make an ointment, and then boil the wine into an ointment. The pill is as big as Wutongzi. Take 20 pills per serving and warm the wine."

腎字的基本解释

腎
shèn
见“肾”。

腎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shèn］
［《廣韻》時忍切，上軫，禪。］
“肾1”的繁体字。
(1)人和高等动物体内的造尿器官，俗称腰子，左右各一，位于腹腔后壁脊柱两侧。旧以为五脏之一。
(2)指外肾，即睾丸。

腎字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腎； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页987第02
【唐韻】時忍切【集韻】【韻會】是忍切【正韻】時軫切，?音祳。【說文】水藏也。【徐曰】按腎主智藏精，皆水之爲也。【廣韻】五藏之一也。【正字通】腎當胃下兩旁，與臍平直，筋外有脂裹，表白裏黑。【素問】腎者作强之官，伎巧出焉。【又】藏各有一，腎獨兩，何也。腎兩者，非皆腎也。其左者爲腎，右者爲命門。【禮·月令】孟冬之月，祭先腎。【註】隂位在下，腎亦在下。【書·盤庚】今予其敷心腹腎腸，歷告爾百姓于朕志。【淮南子·精神訓】腎爲雨。　又引也。【釋名】腎，引也。腎屬水，主引水氣，灌注諸脉也。　又【博雅】堅也。

kidney
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shèn］
["Guangyun" Shi Renqie, Shangzhen, Zen. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Kidney 1".
(1) The urinary organs in humans and higher animals, commonly known as waists, are located on both sides of the spine on the posterior wall of the abdominal cavity. Used to be one of the five internal organs.
(2) Refers to the external kidney, that is, the testis.
kidney

[Tang Yun] Shi Ren Qi [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] is Ren Qi [Zheng Yun] Shi Zhen Qi,? Sound. [Said the text] Mizuzo also. 【Xu Yue】According to the kidney governs the wisdom to store the essence, all is water. [Guangyun] One of the five Tibetans. [Zhengzitong] The kidneys are on both sides of the stomach, and they are straight with the umbilicus. There is fat outside the tendons, and the white is black on the inside. [Suwen] The kidney is a strong official, with skill and skill. [Also] There is one in each Tibet and two in the kidney, so why. Both kidneys are not kidneys. The left is the kidney, and the right is the gate of life. 【Rite·Moon Order】Meng Dong’s month, offering sacrifices to the first kidney. [Note] The Yin position is down, and the kidney is also down. [Shu·Pangeng] Today, I give it to his heart, stomach, and kidneys, and tell the people of Seoul to Zhenzhi. [Huainanzi·Spirit Training] Kidney is rain.　Introduction again. [Release name] Kidney, Yin Ye. The kidneys are water, which draws water and gas and perfuses the veins.　[Bo Ya] Jian Ye.
